{"step_by_step_thinking": "Drug X activates cyclin-dependent kinase 4 (CDK4), which is involved in the regulation of the G1/S phase transition of the cell cycle. The retinoblastoma (Rb) gene is a key regulator of the G1/S phase transition. When Rb is phosphorylated by CDK4, it releases the transcription factor E2F, allowing the cell to progress from G1 to S phase. Therefore, the most likely result of drug X's action on the Rb gene is the initiation of S phase.", "answer_choice": "C"}
